intro: Ecbolium montanum, commonly known as the mountain ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, typically found in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant features a slender, branched stem with small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ecbolium montanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
